PR 327Collection processed by Larry WeimerNew-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024(212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2022-04-27T23:54:26Describing Archives: A Content Standard The documents in the collection are in English.
New-York Historical Society
Richard M. Pieronek photographic slides of New York City
Pieronek, Richard M.
PR 327
0.83 Linear feet in two document boxes
1950s-1976 Richard M. Pieronek (1926-2002) was a photographer based in Hamtramck, Michigan. The collection includes about 1200 color photographic slides taken by Pieronek in New York City at various times from the 1950s to the 1970s. Principal subjects include the July 1976 U.S. bicentennial celebrations and the 1964 World's Fair. There are also images of ships, buildings, street scenes, Times Square, Greenwich Village, San Gennaro Festival, the Statue of Liberty, and other subjects. Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
Arrangement Note
The collection is in the original order as presented by the donor. The slides are held in eight chronologically-arranged cases. Within the cases, the slides are arranged by subject as defined by the photographer.
Biographical/Historical Note
Richard M. Pieronek (1926-2002) was born in Hamtramck, Michigan. He was a World War II veteran and a 1951 graduate of the University of Detroit. He worked for over fifty years as a photographer in the Hamtramck-based family business, Pieronek Studios, which was founded by his father, Paul. Richard Pieronek traveled widely in the United States, including on multiple occasions to New York City. Among these trips was one in 1976 in which Pieronek vacationed with his family in connection with the Bicentennial celebrations.
(The above note is based principally on Pieronek's obituary in the on-line version of the Grosse Point News of 29 November 2002 and the donor's covering letter of 13 March 2017 with the gift.)
Access Restrictions
Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
Use Restrictions
Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.
Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions
Immediate Source of Acquisition Note
Gift of Richard Pieronek's daughter, Patty Pieronek Frost, 2017.
Preferred Citation Note
This collection should be cited as the Richard M. Pieronek photographic slides of New York City, PR 327, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, New-York Historical Society.
Processing Information Note
The collection was processed in May 2017 by archivist Larry Weimer.
Scope and Contents Note
The collection includes about 1200 color slide transparencies of New York City scenes taken by photographer Dick Pieronek. Almost half of the collection includes scenes from the U.S. bicentennial celebrations in July 1976, including the tall ships in New York Harbor, naval parades, and the visit of England's Queen Elizabeth. Another sizable set includes images from the 1964 World's Fair in Flushing, Queens. Other slides, dating from the 1950s-1960s, depict buildings, street scenes, the Statue of Liberty, Times Square, Broadway (including photos of scenes from plays taken from a distance in the audience), Greenwich Village, the San Gennaro Festival, ships at the city docks, and other subject matter. Some slides are "aerial" views taken from the observatory roof of the World Trade Center in 1976 and the RCA Building in 1962. The collection includes a cd of the slides.
New York (N.Y.) -- Photographs. Slides (photographs). New York World's Fair (1964-1965 : New York, N.Y.) [111] -- Photographs
Slide Case 11950s11
Scope and Contents Note
Includes various New York City scenes from the 1950s, including ships, tugboats, piers, harbor, Statue of Liberty, Broadway and scenes from plays (Happy Hunting, Boy Friend, My Fair Lady, Lil Abner), Rockettes, Times Square, subway platforms, and various buildings and street scenes.Slide Case 2196212
Scope and Contents Note
Includes New York City scenes from 1962 including Lincoln Center, Greenwich Village, Greenwich Nursery, skyline from RCA Building, ships (Queen Mary, Constitution, Spanish sailing vessel, others).Slide Case 31963-196413
Scope and Contents Note
Includes Prometheus at Rockefeller Center (1963), street scenes, and San Gennaro Festival.Slide Case 4. World's Fair196414Slide Case 51964-1965, 196925
Scope and Contents Note
Includes ship RMS Queen Elizabeth and New York Harbor (September 1964), Herald Square statue (1965), and street scenes, buildings, etc. (1969).Slide Cases 6, 7, 81976 July26-8
Scope and Contents Note
Includes street scenes and buildings, World Trade Center (including views at and from the roof observatory) and bicentennial event celebrations, including the tall ships parade, naval personnel and ships parade, Queen Elizabeth parade, and ships, including the Queen Elizabeth 2 (QE2).CD of Slides1950s-197611
Scope and Contents Note
The CD is labeled as "Courtesy of Pieronek Studios, Detroit, Michigan."
